metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11191 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** The Linux kernel through 5.0.7, when CONFIG_IA32_AOUT is enabled and ia32_aout is loaded, allows local users to bypass ASLR on setuid a.out programs (if any exist) because install_exec_creds() is called too late in load_aout_binary() in fs/binfmt_aout.c, and thus the ptrace_may_access() check has a race condition when reading /proc/pid/stat. NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability because ASLR for a.out format executables has never been supported. Federico Manuel Bento discovered that the Linux kernel did not properly apply Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) in some situations for setuid a.out binaries. A local attacker could use this to improve the chances of exploiting an existing vulnerability in a setuid a.out binary.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-51-generic - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-4.15.0-51-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-4.15.0-51-lowlatency - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-51-generic - 4.15.0-51.55
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-51-lowlatency - 4.15.0-51.55
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1040-aws - 4.15.0-1040.42
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-1019-azure - 4.18.0-1019.19~18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> This only affects i386 Ubuntu kernels. Additionally, it is very unlikely that systems will have a setuid a.out program installed. sbeattie> configuration changes to disable i386 a.out support are in progress.

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-51.55').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-1019.19~18.04.1').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.35').
linux-gke-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.35').
linux-gke-5.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1011.11~18.04.1').
